TopicTitle: Long Standing error on Mk1-2 Command Pod

Articles.Content:
When is the rotation of the Mk1-2 Command Pod going to be fixed so that it's ladder lines up with EVERY OTHER PART THAT HAS LADDERS?

I can rotate it in the game, but it throws off the rotation calculation, so when I want my ship rotated 0 degrees to line up with a space station, it's always WAY off and I have to eyeball it

I hate eyeballing it.

As a work around, have you tried rotating the docking ports to align the ladder sections? I mean, it would be more convenient to have that aligned for consistency, but I can imagine several workarounds (rotating the docking ports and/or the other parts to align with the pod in the SPH/VAB first versus figuring it out in-situ.) If I recall, didn't docking ports receive a rotation alignment setting in 1.1 or so?

On the other hand... What are you doing with stations that require you to EVA and need/want to use ladders? (Personally, I try to keep EVAs to a minimum if I can help it.)

It's meant to resemble the Apollo capsule, that's why it is how it is.

But I agree. Would prefer to have a Dragon V2-esque kind of pod instead of Mk1-2

40 minutes ago, Veeltch said:

But I agree. Would prefer to have a Dragon V2-esque kind of pod instead of Mk1-2

Although Dragon 2 wasn't a thing yet when 0.17 was released.

I would like the mk1-2 ladder realigned. However, it would break a lot of existing crafts.

1 hour ago, Ultimate Steve said:

Although Dragon 2 wasn't a thing yet when 0.17 was released.

Well, actually the DragonRider (now Dragon 2) was announced in 2010 (Mk2-1 was added in 0.16 in 2012). It's just that the final look of it was still not certain. And yet RAPIER is in the game even though the SABRE engine was not even built.

I know it's kind of silly to compare an SSTO engine to a manned capsule, but would be nice to see some fresh manned command parts in the game.

Edited October 8, 2016 by Veeltch
Whether the Dragon was out or not, a little forethought would have shown the gameplay problems with an offset hatch.

17 hours ago, Runescope said:

...EVERY OTHER PART THAT HAS LADDERS?...

You kind of forgot all of the spaceplane cockpits.

Anyways, fixing the hatch on the Mk2 cockpit isn't as easy as it sounds. It would probably require a redo of most of the pod. If you take a look at the inside there's a kerbal sitting right where the hatch would be moved to line it up. I'll go take a look at the internal view again but as I recall there's not much of another place for the kerbal to be moved without his/her head being stuck inside something. The inside would have to be completely redone, and that sounds like a lot of work for what amounts to (imho) a minor inconvenience

Edited October 8, 2016 by EpicSpaceTroll139

I'd rather they relocate the ladder on the other stuff to match the Mk1-2 pod, to be honest. Having ladders at one of the cardinal points interferes with RCS thruster placement sometimes.

I do agree that they should all be consistent, at whichever position.

Can this be done with a simple MM patch, if I recall correctly default rotations can be done in MM.

 

edit- I forgot the navball would be messed up then, crap...
